channel.title: android on Gameblabla's blog
channel.description: Recent content in android on Gameblabla's blog

item.title: A look at Android-x86
item.description: Android-x86 is a project that intended to port Android to the x86 architecture. Before even Android-x86, Google had released an Android emulator that’s actually running x86 binaries for performance reasons

item.title: Fire HD 7 - Review
item.description: The Amazon Fire HD 7” is a FireOS tablet released in 2014.) At 39$ refurbished (50€ in Europe), it is one of the cheapest tablet you can get out there.

item.title: Older devices - Sony Xperia X8
item.description: The Sony Xperia X8 was first announced in June 2010 and released in September the same year. It was quite a low-end device, even for its time.

item.title: Older devices - Sony Xperia Neo V
item.description: The Sony Xperia Neo V was released on October 2011. It was a cheaper alternative to the Sony Xperia Neo released previously in March of the same year.

item.title: Older devices - LG Optimus L3 E400
item.description: The LG Optimus L3 E400 is an Android device first released on February 2012. Even back when it was released, it was a fairly low-end device.

item.title: Rubby Bird 100 - Official Release
item.description: I am proud to announce the release of Rubby Bird 100, the sequel to Rubby Bird ! You thought rubbing one bird was easy enough ?

item.title: KillMinds - Official Release
item.description: It is now available for Android (Google Play Store) and Sailfish OS. A Firefox OS version was finished but it is currently waiting Mozilla’s aproval.
